thig5.9:1.1_0: My hair mown off, covered in mud,
thig5.9:1.2_0: I used to wander wearing just one robe.
thig5.9:1.3_0: I saw fault where there was none,
thig5.9:1.4_0: and blind to the actual fault.
thig5.9:2.4_0: at the fore of the mendicant Saṅgha,
thig5.9:3.1_0: I bent my knee and bowed,
thig5.9:3.2_0: and in his presence raised my joined palms.
thig5.9:4.1_0: “I’ve wandered among the Aṅgans and Magadhans,
thig5.9:4.3_0: I have eaten the alms-food of the nations
thig5.9:4.4_0: free of debt for fifty years.”
thig5.9:5.1_0: “O! He has made so much merit!
thig5.9:5.2_0: That lay-follower is so very wise.
thig5.9:5.4_0: who is released from all ties.”
